Math.RandomGenerator Class

Math.RandomGenerator is a class for generating random numbers using the Mersenne Twister method.

The constructor syntax is as follows:
new Math.RandomGenerator([<seed>]);

If a numeric value is specified in the constructor, the random number generator is initialized with that value.
If a dictionary object containing a state saved by the serialize method is specified in the constructor, the random number generator can be created in that state.
If the constructor argument is omitted, the random number generator is initialized with a random value based on the current time (in the case of Kirikiri 2, it is initialized with a random number from a generator based on environmental noise instead of the current time).

randomize

The randomize method initializes the random number generator. The arguments are the same as those specified for the constructor.

random

The random method returns a floating-point random value greater than or equal to 0 and less than 1.0.

random32

The random32 method returns an integer random value between 0 and 4,294,967,295 (up to 0xffffffff).

random63

The random63 method returns an integer random value between 0 and 9,223,372,036,854,775,807 (up to 0x7fffffffffffffff).

random64

The random64 method returns an integer random value between -9,223,372,036,854,775,808 and 9,223,372,036,854,775,807.

serialize

The serialize method returns a dictionary object that records the current state. This dictionary object can be passed to the constructor or the randomize method to recreate the current state again.

Copyright notice

The implementation of the Mersenne Twister method uses a modified version of:

A C-program for MT19937, with initialization improved 2002/2/10. Coded by Takuji Nishimura and Makoto Matsumoto.

We are grateful to both authors for making their useful program source code available.
